content:
• Friday, January 11, 2013
  • ZNGA

    As Zynga (ZNGA +4.8%) preps its international gambling launch, the company is quietly building...

    As Zynga (ZNGA +4.8%) preps its international gambling launch, the company is quietly building an arsenal of gambling-related patents. Research firm Envision IP notes Zynga recently obtained 38 patents from R&D lab/patent troll Walker Digital, and that 33 of them are gambling-related. Altogether, Zynga is now believed to have 89 U.S. patents and 36 applications. Does the company plan to use this IP to simply differentiate its offerings, or to stamp out would-be rivals?

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • HOV

    Another homebuilder languishing today in spite of Merrill's positive comments is Hovnanian...

    Another homebuilder languishing today in spite of Merrill's positive comments is Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -1%). JP Morgan upped its rating from Underweight to Neutral, but warns that the company's capital structure requires additional equity, and its adjusted price-to-book is highly expensive.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • ARQL

    Despite ArQule's (ARQL -2.4%) disappointing top-line results from its Phase 2 trial of...

    Despite ArQule's (ARQL -2.4%) disappointing top-line results from its Phase 2 trial of tivantinib in patients with refractory or relapsed colorectal cancer, Burrill Institutional Research thinks its use in treating hepatocellular carcinoma (NYSE:HCC-OLD) could still drive shares higher. In patients with HCC, Tivantinib demonstrated statistically significant results versus a placebo in reducing tumor progression, and the firm thinks the treatment could reach global peak sales of $278M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • WLT

    Stocks in the materials space are among the weakest performers, as miners and steelmakers weigh...

    Stocks in the materials space are among the weakest performers, as miners and steelmakers weigh following hotter-than-expected Chinese inflation data. Among non-precious metals: WLT -5.8%, CLF -4.3%, CENX -9.2%. Also, BHP Billiton (BHP -2.6%) and Rio Tinto (RIO -2.9%) were both downgraded to Neutral from Outperform at Macquarie.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 10 Comments
  • BB

    Not only has Research In Motion (RIMM +11.4%) brushed off BMO's downgrade and a Vodafone service...

    Not only has Research In Motion (RIMM +11.4%) brushed off BMO's downgrade and a Vodafone service outage, the company is now among the day's biggest tech winners. In addition to short-covering, RIM is probably getting a lift from new leaked pictures of the BlackBerry Z10, RIM's first touchscreen-only BB10 device. The pictures show a sleek-looking device that supports easy switching between Personal and Work modes. Also, Sprint has joined other nationwide carriers in confirming it will sell BB10 hardware. (X10 images)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 15 Comments
  • TELK

    Shares of Telik (OTCQB:TELK +57.2%) are soaring on heavy volume following a brief halt after the...

    Shares of Telik (OTCQB:TELK +57.2%) are soaring on heavy volume following a brief halt after the FDA grants orphan drug status for Telintra, a treatment for myelodysplastic syndrome.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • BZH

    One homebuilder not benefiting from Merrill's upbeat take on the sector today is Beazer Homes...

    One homebuilder not benefiting from Merrill's upbeat take on the sector today is Beazer Homes (BZH -1.5%). JPMorgan downgraded the stock to Neutral prior to the open on valuation and concerns over relative order growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK +6.3%) is rallying, apparently on a rumor IBM could bid for the company. As the top...

    Splunk (SPLK +6.3%) is rallying, apparently on a rumor IBM could bid for the company. As the top vendor in a fast-growing analytics software segment, Splunk is definitely in IBM's wheelhouse. But it also trades at lofty multiples and would probably require a buyout price north of $4B. 18.8% of the float was shorted as of Dec. 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEC

    Midday top 10 gainers: UPIP +31%. KGJI +20%. INFY +17%. DNDN +15%. REDF +14%. FLML +14%. BBY...

    Midday top 10 gainers: UPIP +31%. KGJI +20%. INFY +17%. DNDN +15%. REDF +14%. FLML +14%. BBY +12%. SIFY +11%. ICAD +10%. BCRX +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: NEWL -29%. ARQL -15%. YOD -15%. PDEX -12%. BV-OLD -11%. RGLS -10%. FARO -9%. CENX -9%. MY -9%. STXS -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (BRCD +2.3%) and F5 (FFIV +2%) move higher after Brocade scores an injunction on...

    Brocade (BRCD +2.3%) and F5 (FFIV +2%) move higher after Brocade scores an injunction on application delivery controllers sold by private A10 Networks. A10 is more of a rival to F5 than Brocade, but the injunction raises the odds Brocade will get a nice payoff after being awarded $112M in damages from A10 by a jury in August.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon's (DNDN +15%) upside surge today may be impressive on the face of it, but it's really...

    Dendreon's (DNDN +15%) upside surge today may be impressive on the face of it, but it's really just a blip on the screen when you consider the stock was at $17.50 just 11 months ago. Or, for that matter, two years back when it was trading at $50. While Provenge may be the focal point of today's move, it still faces hurdles - like a $93K price tag for a round of therapy - but the real catalyst to DNDN's story may just be its takeout value. The stock has a large institutional base, with heavyweights like J.P. Morgan and Tang Capital behind it, and with its recent restructuring, the payout could be big at the stocks current price tag.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • NFLX

    The USPS is giving Netflix (NFLX +3.6%) an unfair advantage over disc-rental rivals through its...

    The USPS is giving Netflix (NFLX +3.6%) an unfair advantage over disc-rental rivals through its policies for processing Netflix DVDs, a federal appeals court rules in a suit brought by game-rental service GameFly. The court has ordered the USPS to change the situation or provide a good reason why it shouldn't. Separately, Pres. Obama has removed the last hurdle to the sharing of Netflix rental/browing activity on Facebook by signing a video privacy law amendment recently approved by Congress.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRH

    GreenHunter Energy (GRH +6.9%) is initiated at Outperform with a $3 target at Boenning &...

    GreenHunter Energy (GRH +6.9%) is initiated at Outperform with a $3 target at Boenning & Scattergood, which cites operations in major shale plays led by Appalachia and recent Eagle Ford acquisitions. The firm says revenue and earnings growth will be driven by continued expansion of services in all plays, acquisitions and utilization of assets including SWD and trucking.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 2 Comments

  • The inaugural midday release of the USDA's January crop report doesn't disappoint, with...

    The inaugural midday release of the USDA's January crop report doesn't disappoint, with corn reversing early losses and now sharply green as Dec. 1 stocks come in at 8.03B bushels vs. expectations of 8.21B. Ending stocks are estimated at a slim 602M bushels vs. expectations of 667M. Beans are down after production came in higher than expected. Wheat jumps on lower-than-anticipated planted acres.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA +4.6%) trades above $33 for the first time since its October Q3 warning after...

    Informatica (INFA +4.6%) trades above $33 for the first time since its October Q3 warning after JMP says its checks indicate the company may have been more successful in closing large deals in Q4 than it has been in a while. The firm sees Informatica, which has been busy overhauling its salesforce, beating Q4 estimates and also posting 2013 EPS slightly above consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +6.8%) gets some follow-through off yesterday's +10% run, moving...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +6.8%) gets some follow-through off yesterday's +10% run, moving higher again today off the news that its sleep drug Intermezzo dodged an FDA bullet requiring a number of other sleep aids to reduce their dosage due to the risk of impaired cognitive function issues. The drug is the company's first FDA approved product.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI +2.6%) is rallying after a positive Cowen note manages to overshadow bleak...

    Activision (ATVI +2.6%) is rallying after a positive Cowen note manages to overshadow bleak industry data from NPD. The firm thinks the game developer's positioning remains strong in light of growing game subscriptions, and sees new titles acting as growth catalysts in the coming years. Also: Call of Duty: Black Ops II topped NPD's December bestseller list, and Skylanders Giants came in at #8.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • CATM

    Cardtronics (CATM +4.8%) moves higher after JPMorgan ups the shares to Overweight on a valuation...

    Cardtronics (CATM +4.8%) moves higher after JPMorgan ups the shares to Overweight on a valuation call, saying that concerns over interchange revenue have unduly pressured the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +4.2%) bucks a weak tape after pricing its 2.7M share secondary...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +4.2%) bucks a weak tape after pricing its 2.7M share secondary offering at $26.24, flat with yesterday's close. The biopharmaceutical company said it expects net proceeds from the offering - which represents around 10% of its float - to be roughly $67.9M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • GLW

    Corning (GLW -3.5%) heads south following a downgrade to Neutral from Goldman. The firm argues...

    Corning (GLW -3.5%) heads south following a downgrade to Neutral from Goldman. The firm argues the catalysts that drove its September upgrade - improving LCD industry fundamentals and capital allocation moves - are mostly played out in the wake of Corning's Q3 beat and Q4 pre-announcement. Moreover, it sees forex and a Q1 LCD inventory correction producing downside to estimates. Corning closed yesterday right around where it was when Goldman made its upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 7 Comments
  • NUVA

    Shares of Nuvasive (NUVA +3.5%) get a boost this morning from Janney Montgomery, who initiated...

    Shares of Nuvasive (NUVA +3.5%) get a boost this morning from Janney Montgomery, who initiated the shares with a Buy and a price target of $22 on the back of the company's upbeat report yesterday that it expects to beat FY12 Street expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • GEC

    Unwired Planet (UPIP +34.4%), formerly Openwave, soars after buying 2,185 patents and...

    Unwired Planet (UPIP +34.4%), formerly Openwave, soars after buying 2,185 patents and applications related to mobile networks from Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC). UPIP will also receive another 100 "patent assets" annually from 2014-2018. Ericsson has the right to 20% of the first $100M in revenue produced by the patents, 50% of the next $400M, and 70% of anything beyond. Thus, UPIP becomes another version of Rockstar Bidco to Ericsson, a vehicle for monetizing its IP without having to worry about countersuits. (8-K) (PR) (Microsoft deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA -2.5%) expresses confidence in its Dreamliner 787 as the FAA orders a review of the...

    Boeing (BA -2.5%) expresses confidence in its Dreamliner 787 as the FAA orders a review of the plane following a string of recent mishaps. At a press conference, the head of Boeing's commercial airplane unit says the 787's performance so far is not "exceptionally unusual" for a new plane, and recent safety issues were not caused by outsourcing production or by ramping up production too quickly.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 6 Comments
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -10.5%) continues to bleed in response to news of a DOJ antitrust suit that...

    Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD -10.5%) continues to bleed in response to news of a DOJ antitrust suit that effectively seeks to undo the PowerReviews acquisition - shares are now down 25% from Wednesday's close. Bazaarvoice has responded by accusing the DOJ of relying on "dated documents;" by arguing its product ratings/review solutions still face competition from social media, community forums, and other tools; and by promising it will be vindicated in court. BMO has downgraded Bazaarvoice to Market Perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) rocks a double-digit gain after better-than-expected holiday sales (I, II)...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) rocks a double-digit gain after better-than-expected holiday sales (I, II) trump a free cash flow forecast that has nosedived to $500M from $1.25B-$1.5B just last August. The vibe on the retailer for the moment is that by averting a "debacle," Best Buy kept alive its chances for a Richard Schulze buyout.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) opens weak after getting tagged a Sell by UBS. A general consensus on the...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) opens weak after getting tagged a Sell by UBS. A general consensus on the Street seems to be forming that the retailer will have to take some drastic action to save its cash flow situation. While guesses on the Hail Mary play vary, they all end up with JCP's share price getting hit again.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • CYH

    BAML likes momentum this morning, with two hot hospital stocks - Community Health (NYSE:CYH) and...

    BAML likes momentum this morning, with two hot hospital stocks - Community Health (NYSE:CYH) and Tenet Healthcare (NYSE:THC) - both upgraded to Buy. Both are higher by more than 3%. Earlier: BAML upgrades homebuilders.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • INFY

    Low expectations are doing wonders for Infosys (INFY +18.4%), which has taken off ...

    Low expectations are doing wonders for Infosys (INFY +18.4%), which has taken off  following its FQ3 beat. With full-year figures aided by the beat, the company is now guiding for FY13 (ends March 31) revenue of at least $7.45B and EPS of at least $2.97, above a consensus of $7.32B and $2.95. 8 major outsourcing deals with a combined value of $731M were signed, and cloud engagements (previous) rose by 20 Q/Q to 190. Gross margin, hurt by rising wages, fell 100 bps Q/Q and 600 bps Y/Y to 37%. WIT +6.6%. CTSH +4.2%. ACN +1%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • GEC

    Premarket gainers: UPIP +30%. INFY +15%. DNDN +13%. BBY +7%.Losers: ARQL -16%. KBR -9%. SANW...

    Losers: ARQL -16%. KBR -9%. SANW -8%. OCZ -7%. JCP -6%.

  • GIS

    Shares of General Mills (NYSE:GIS) shed 1.2% premarket after the company takes on a harsh...

    Shares of General Mills (NYSE:GIS) shed 1.2% premarket after the company takes on a harsh downgrade from Goldman Sachs. The firm shines its light on General Mills due to "product cycle issues" with a retail portfolio it call over-extended. Both the cereal and non-Greek yogurt categories look to be at risk to Goldman.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • TGA

    Transglobe Energy (NASDAQ:TGA) -1.9% premarket after saying it will plug and abandon the Al...

    Transglobe Energy (NASDAQ:TGA) -1.9% premarket after saying it will plug and abandon the Al Azayem #1 well at its South Mariut project in Egypt after failing to find hydrocarbons. TGA expects total well cost of ~$9M, lower than the budgeted $9.6M cost for a 14,500 ft. test.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • ARQL

    Reopened for trade, ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) falls 21% after the testing failure of its key drug,...

    Reopened for trade, ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) falls 21% after the testing failure of its key drug, tivantnib. The rest of the company's pipeline.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • SODA

    Shares of SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) move up 3.5% premarket to $48.65 on the back of a Citi...

    Shares of SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) move up 3.5% premarket to $48.65 on the back of a Citi initiation at Buy. The firm calls it one of the fastest growth stories in consumer products with new distribution channels opening up.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • TUWLF

    Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF) slides more than 5% in London trading after saying it expects to post...

    Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF) slides more than 5% in London trading after saying it expects to post ~$2.35B in revenue for 2012 and that unsuccessful explorations write-offs rose to $299M from $121M in 2011. Exploration and appraisal campaigns for 2013 will target 1B boe, with more than 40 wells planned.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) +12% premarket after an upgrade to Buy with price target of $10 from...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) +12% premarket after an upgrade to Buy with price target of $10 from Bernstein. The analysts see steady growth for the company's provenge and say the chance of takeover or mergers provide additional upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • RIO

    Downgrades fly on the big Australian miners with both Rio Tinto and BHP Billiton downgraded to...

    Downgrades fly on the big Australian miners with both Rio Tinto and BHP Billiton downgraded to Hold at Macquarie, and BHP downgraded to Hold at BAML. RIO -2.3%, BHP -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • ARQL

    ArQule's (NASDAQ:ARQL) tivantinib (ARQ 197) did not meet its primary endpoint in Phase 2...

    ArQule's (NASDAQ:ARQL) tivantinib (ARQ 197) did not meet its primary endpoint in Phase 2 testing, says the company. Shares remain halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reverse direction to move up 2.1% in premarket trading after the...

    Shares of Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reverse direction to move up 2.1% in premarket trading after the retailer shows slipping sales at comparable stores but beats the most dire of projections from analysts. Much of the focus on the company with the sales report in the rear-view mirror will now turn back to on if a Richard Schulze-led deal to buy the company will take off or not.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 AM
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM) is downgraded to Sell at BMO, with price target cut to $9. Shares...

    Research in Motion (RIMM) is downgraded to Sell at BMO, with price target cut to $9. Shares -3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 AM | 26 Comments

  • Stock futures are marginally lower after the S&P hit a five-year high yesterday, and ahead...

    Stock futures are marginally lower after the S&P hit a five-year high yesterday, and ahead of trade data and earnings from Wells Fargo, which will release the first Q4 report from a major bank. As in Europe and Asia, accelerating Chinese inflation could dampen the mood. Dow -0.5%, S&P -0.1%, Nasdaq flat. Crude -0.7%, Gold -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 AM

  • Asian shares are mostly lower while their European counterparts trade in tight ranges, with the...

    Asian shares are mostly lower while their European counterparts trade in tight ranges, with the unveiling of a ¥10.3T ($117B) stimulus plan in Japan and a sizable current-account deficit counter-balancing the dampening effect on stocks of increased Chinese inflation. Japan +1.4%, Hong Kong -0.4%, China -1.8%, India -0.2%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.2%, London flat, Paris +0.1%, Frankfurt flat, Milan +0.1%, Madrid +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 AM
